snippet: Law enforcement officials said it had been generations since the nation endured two separate episodes in which so many police officers were killed....
abstract: Authorities describe unprecedented level of anxiety and vulnerability within law enforcement after fatal shootings targeting police officers in Dallas and Baton Rouge, La; officials say they are considering ways to increase protection for officers while maintaining their visibility and effectiveness.

byline.original: By TIMOTHY WILLIAMS and ALAN BLINDER
byline.contributor: Julie Bloom, Yamiche Alcindor, John Eligon, Monica Davey and Nikole Hannah-Jones contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Law enforcement officials said it had been generations since the nation endured two separate episodes in which so many police officers were killed.

headline.main: Baton Rouge Attack Deepens Anguish for Police: ‘We’ve Seen Nothing Like This’
headline.print_headline: Dread and Anguish for Police: ‘We’ve Seen Nothing Like This’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
